title: The Masterpiece of the Month: St. John on Patmos, Nicolas Poussin
description: During October 1939, a painting by prominent seventeenth century French classical artist Nicolas Poussin titled “Landscape with Saint John on Patmos” was displayed as Masterpiece of the Month. As described by the newsletter announcing its exhibition, in this composition “Poussin has paid more attention to the setting and the style. The Apostle, writing his book of Revelation, with the eagle (his symbol) almost lost in the shadow beside him, draws little attention to himself. One is more interested by the horizontal frontal platform—a spacious stage on which the actors pose.”

input: The Masterpiece of the Month: St. John on Patmos, Nicolas Poussin
